references.citationString: De Meulder, T., Lefevre, L., Roland, M., Segers, J., Van Look, J., ICOS RI, 2021. ICOS ETC Eddy Flux Raw ASCII daily archive, Lochristi, 2021-06-05, https://hdl.handle.net/11676/Y8WGDi-wcegIW3ZxIYHYsa1t

comments: The station Lochristi (ICOS code BE-Lcr) is located in Lochristi, Belgium, about 11 km from the city of Ghent (Province East of Flanders). The site is a short-rotation coppice plantation of poplar ( Populus spp.) with flat topography. The region is pedologically described as a sandy region. The current total area of the plantation is 11 ha and the tree density is 8000 trees ha-1 . Twelve selected poplar genotypes were planted in monoclonal blocks in 2010.
self.label: BE-Lcr

documentation.name: BE-Lcr Associated ICOS Ecosystem Station Labelling Report.pdf

comments: Lands dominated by woody vegetation with a percent cover >60% and height exceeding 2 meters. Consists of broadleaf tree communities with an annual cycle of leaf-on and leaf-off periods.
ecosystemType.label: Deciduous Broadleaf Forests

format.label: Multi-file zip archive with ETC raw time series

self.label: ICOS ETC Eddy Flux Raw ASCII daily archive
